results.title: Scabby mouth in sheep
results.brief_description: This film shows the troubles cased by this highly contagious disease in sheep, and explains methods of treatment and prevention by vaccination.

results.title: SBS Insight: millennium bug
results.creator_credit: Australia. Special Broadcasting Service and Tatjana Djamin
results.brief_description: Just when we thought technology was under control the millennium bug fear sent shockwaves throughout the world with repercussions from PC’s to computers controlling aircraft and technical hospital equipment. The computer glitch known as the millennium bug threatened to come into being if all computers weren’t made compliant by the December 31st deadline. This episode of “Insight” looks at the crisis facing airlines and, in particular, Ansett’s strategy management of the problem. It looks at the financial cost of compliance, the formation of the millennium taskforce and the legal ramifications. Explains why technology failed us and an anthropologist, minister and historian thrash out millennium fears - which proves quite interesting in hindsight. Originally screened 28 May 1998.

results.title: Saying no: a few words to young women about sex
results.creator_credit: Crommie and Crommie, David Crommie and Karen Crommie
results.brief_description: Aimed at adolescent girls this film shows them how to cope with demands made by boys or men for sexual relations when they do not wish to participate. Highlights some standard manipulative responses by males to females when they are denied sex and indicates how girls should go about handling such responses in an assertive manner.

results.title: Say what you mean
results.brief_description: Language as the principle instrument of oral communication, dramatising events in the lives of students of a college speech class, showing how they learn to choose language that clearly states an idea, is appropriate for the listener, and is interesting and forceful. From the “McGraw Hill Communication Series”.

results.title: Say it with words
results.brief_description: There are important differences between writing in private and speaking in public. This program demonstrates the following skills: preparing the speech, rehearsal, and the correct use of visual aids. A humorous program with Judy McBride, David Argue, Tracy Harvey and Mark Little.

results.title: Say goodbye
results.creator_credit: Wolper Productions and David H. Vowel

results.title: Say English cheese
results.brief_description:
Episode number 10 of Series “Review: 27th year”.
Cheese making today is an industry, but still a craft. And English cheeses are now better value than ever, in price and nutritional value. From the series “Review No 10 - 27th year (635)”.

results.title: Say bow-wow
results.creator_credit: Australian Broadcasting Commission, Kip Porteous and Gil Brealey
results.brief_description: A satire on non-conformity and artistic pretentiousness. A director is ridiculed at a script conference and humiliated in a street chase. Suddenly he becomes a clever, and therefore, famous dog. But despite initial celebration he soon incurs public displeasure, is chased through the streets and meets final indignities of the dog-catchers net and van.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Australian Broadcasting Commission, Kip Porteous and Gil Brealey

results.title: Say a prayer for me: the chaplins of the Vietnam war
results.creator_credit: Australia. Army, Don Keyes and Andrew Williams
results.brief_description: A documentary about the Australian military chaplains who served in Vietnam. Combining archival footage with interviews with chaplains and soldiers, the film considers the issues they were forced to confront on a daily basis. The underlying theme is the evident humanity of the chaplains, who had to deal with their own trauma while providing support for soldiers emotionally and physically torn apart by the brutality of the Vietnam war. The film also discuss the negative reactions the military chaplains faced from other clergy when they returned from Vietnam due to their involvement in an unpopular war.
